alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lawrence; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 9:03PM EST until March 12 at 2:20PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River, Big Blue River. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following creek in Indiana... Mill Creek. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following waterways in Indiana... Sugar Creek, Flatrock River, Driftwood River, East Fork White River, Eel River. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Moderate flooding in the Seymour area on the East Fork White River is expected to persist into Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Seymour. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.1 feet, During June 2010, SR 258 east of Cortland was closed for the second time in 10 days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EST Tuesday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Saturday morning and continue falling to 8.4 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1000 PM EST.
